contentrichtext.text: ([[Japan]] > [[Yamaguchi Prefecture]] > '''Yoshiki District''') {{nihongo|'''Yoshiki'''|吉敷郡|Yoshiki-gun}} was a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in Yamaguchi Prefecture. The district had a total estimated [[population]] of 39,900 and the total area was 82.98 km². (2003) The day before the district dissolved, there were three towns. * [[Aio, Yamaguchi|Aio]] * [[Ajisu, Yamaguchi|Ajisu]] * [[Ogōri, Yamaguchi|Ogōri]] On October 1, 2005, all three towns merged with the city of Yamaguchi and the town of [[Tokuji, Yamaguchi|Tokuji]] from [[Saba District, Yamaguchi|Saba District]] to form the new city of [[Yamaguchi, Yamaguchi|Yamaguchi]] and the district dissolved ==District Timeline== ===Mergers and separations=== * 1889 Due to enforcement of the town and village system in Japan, the town of Yamaguchi<ref>40 towns (Kami-Kanakoso, Shimo-Kanakoso, Yawatanobaba, Noda, Kami-Tatekōji, Shimo-Tatekōji, Ishigan-non, Dōso, Enseiji, Dōnomae, Ōichi, Shogan-shōji, Kubo-shōji, Sentō-shōji, Shinbaba, Ushirogawara, Nakagawara, Hayamada, Shin, Komeya, Otsubone-shōji, Ima-shōji, Nakaichi, Aimono-shōji, Tachiuri, Matsunoki, Kitano-shōji, Babadono-shōji, Yonedono-shōji, Dōjōmonzen, Imaichi, Imamichi, Wani-ishi, Ōzuke, Shinbashi, Nishimonzen, Itoyone-shōji, Arataka, Ta and Nakasanai) were merged and form the Town of Yamaguchi at this time.</ref> and the villages of Kami-unorei, Shimo-unorei, Yoshiki, Miyano, Ōuchi, Hirakawa, Yabara-asada, Niho, Osaba, Daidō, Suzenji, Sue, Natajima, Ogōri, Kagawa, Aiofutajima, Aio, Iseki, Higashi-kiwa and Nishi-kiwa were formed as the Yoshiki District. (1 town, 20 villages) * July 1, 1898 The village of Yabara-asada changed its name to the village of Ōtoshi. * April 1, 1899 The village of Sayama broke off from the village of Iseki. (1 town, 21 villages) * August 1, 1901 The village of Ogōri gained town status to become the town of [[Ogōri, Yamaguchi|Ogōri]]. (2 towns, 20 villages) * April 1, 1905 The town of Yamaguchi and the village of Kami-unorei merged. (2 towns, 19 villages) * July 1, 1915 The town of Yamaguchi and the village of Shimo-unorei merged. (2 towns, 18 villages) * April 10, 1929 The town of Yamaguchi and the village of [[Yoshiki, Yamaguchi|Yoshiki]] merged to form the city of [[Yamaguchi, Yamaguchi|Yamaguchi]]. (1 town, 17 villages) * April 29, 1940 The village of Aio gained town status to become the town of [[Aio, Yamaguchi|Aio]]. (2 towns, 16 villages) * November 3, 1940 The village of Iseki gained town status and renamed to become the town of [[Ajisu, Yamaguchi|Ajisu]]. (3 towns, 15 villages) * April 1, 1941 The village of [[Miyano,Yamaguchi|Miyano]] merged into the city of Yamaguchi. (3 towns, 14 villages) * November 1, 1943 The village of [[Nishikiwa, Yamaguchi|Nishi-kiwa]] merged into the city of [[Ube, Yamaguchi|Ube]]. (3 towns, 13 villages) * April 1, 1944 The towns of [[Ogōri, Yamaguchi|Ogōri]] and [[Ajisu, Yamaguchi|Ajisu]], and the villages of [[Hirakawa, Yamaguchi|Hirakawa]], [[Ōtoshi, Yamaguchi|Ōtoshi]], [[Sue, Yamaguchi|Sue]], [[Natajima, Yamaguchi|Natajima]], [[Aiofutajima, Yamaguchi|Aiofutajima]], [[Kagawa, Yamaguchi|Kagawa]] and [[Sayama, Yamaguchi|Sayama]] merged with the city of Yamaguchi to become the new city of Yamaguchi. (1 town, 6 villages) * November 23, 1947 The town of Ajisu broke off from the city of Yamaguchi. (2 towns, 6 villages) * November 1, 1949 The town of [[Ogōri, Yamaguchi|Ogōri]] broke off from the city of Yamaguchi. (3 towns, 6 villages) * October 1, 1954 The village of [[Higashikiwa, Yamaguchi|Higashi-kiwa]] merged into the city of Ube. (3 towns, 5 villages) * April 1, 1955 The villages of Ōuchi, [[Niho, Yamaguchi|Niho]], and [[Osaba, Yamaguchi|Osaba]] merged to form the town of [[Ōuchi, Yamaguchi|Ōuchi]]. (4 towns, 2 villages) * April 10, 1955 The village of Daidō merged into the city of [[Hofu, Yamaguchi|Hōfu]]. (4 towns, 1 village) * November 3, 1956 The village of [[Suzenji, Yamaguchi|Suzenji]] merged into the city of Yamaguchi. (4 towns) * May 1, 1963 The town of Ōuchi merged into the city of Yamaguchi. (3 towns) * October 1, 2005 The towns of Aio, Ajisu and Ogōri merged with the city of Yamaguchi and the town of [[Tokuji, Yamaguchi|Tokuji]] from [[Saba District, Yamaguchi|Saba District]] to become the new city of [[Yamaguchi, Yamaguchi|Yamaguchi]]. Yoshiki District was dissolved as a result of this merger. ==See also== * [[List of dissolved districts of Japan]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{coord missing|Yamaguchi Prefecture}} [[Category:Former districts of Yamaguchi Prefecture|Yoshiki District]]
